35 days and counting until Election Day. Have you:
→ Registered to vote?
→ Phone banked?
→ Requested an absentee ballot (if necessary)?
→ Volunteered on a campaign?
→ Looked up your polling place?
→ Checked to see if your friends and family are registered to vote?

 https://sapoa.org/press-release/sapoa-endorses-senator-ted-cruz/

#txsen

Brett Kavanaugh has lied repeatedly to the Senate, even while under oath.

An aspiring Supreme Court Justice should be a person of integrity. Kavanaugh’s dishonesty should disqualify him from sitting on the nation’s highest court.   
 
https://slate.com/news-and-politics/2018/09/kavanaugh-lied-senate-judiciary-committee.html

FACT: Judge Kavanaugh will threaten Roe v. Wade, health care, reproductive rights, LGBTQ rights, environmental protections, and so many more of our priorities. #StopKavanaugh http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DogwPsgUYAAeCMO.png

If you’re losing hope, think of the senior whose Social Security is at risk. 

If you’re losing faith, think of the 1 in 5 children in America who live in poverty. 

If you are tired, you are not alone. Your hard work *will* pay off. 35 days out! #TuesdayThoughts —NP

Today in 1967, Thurgood Marshall, @HowardU alum, @NAACP chief counsel, and the great-grandson of slaves, was sworn in as the first Black Supreme Court Justice. He fought to make equal justice under law a reality for every American. That fight continues. #StopKanavaugh http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DoiwkzWXgAAaKeZ.jpg

Exhibit #237 of why anyone running for federal office should have to disclose their tax returns. Congress needs to pass my legislation to #EndCorruptionNow, which would force candidates (and @realDonaldTrump) to make their tax returns public. https://nyti.ms/2P6S6mK?smid=nytcore-ios-share

RT @SenateDems Judge Kavanaugh has not displayed the demeanor we expect in a nominee. He has not shown himself to be impartial. He does not come across as 100% honest and truthful, which is what we need in a Supreme Court Justice. https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1RDGlWgNnQVKL
@MoCityReb @tedcruz We've got you covered. Follow us back and send a DM with your address and we'll get you another.

RT @SenCortezMasto What began as a beautiful night 1 year ago was instead met with terror when a senseless act of violence cut 58 lives short on #1October. It's now been a year & Congress fails to take meaningful action to address gun violence. It's past time we come together to make America safer. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1046882804691361793/img/oYTlJse4DdYtVGrO.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1046882804691361793/vid/320x180/x6dYfU2J2S7iPfP3.mp4?tag=8

I am saddened to hear about the passing of State Senator Dorothy Hukill. I fondly remember the years I served with her in the Florida House of Representatives. Jeanette and I are praying for her family during this difficult time. She will be dearly missed.

RT @SenTedCruz Making the historic tax cuts permanent is just one more way Congress can continue delivering on the promises made to the American people. I’m proud of my colleagues in the House for doing just that & urge the Senate to make these tax cuts permanent. --> https://www.cruz.senate.gov/?p=press_release&id=4119

RT @4TaxFairness "The president has long sold himself as a self-made billionaire, but a Times investigation found that he received at least $413 million in today’s dollars from his father’s real estate empire, much of it through tax dodges in the 1990s." -@nytimes http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DoiAIrmXkAEvObJ.jpg

Another example of why we must #EndCorruptionNow from @BetsyDeVosED – who hired an ex #4profit lobbyist to decide if negligent college accreditor ACICS could keep its rubber stamp of approval. Big surprise: they sided with shady for-profits over students. https://www.chronicle.com/article/Education-Dept-Moves-to-Give/244685

RT @taxmarch “By age 3, Mr. Trump was earning $200,000 a year in today’s dollars from his father’s empire. He was a millionaire by age 8.” 

It's clear we need a fair tax code that's not rigged for the rich. https://trib.al/WUr9FN7

Americans are sick of the wealthy and well-connected running Washington to their own benefit. My bill to #EndCorruptionNow would end self-dealing by elected officials, slam the revolving door shut, and end lobbying as we know it. https://www.vox.com/2018/8/21/17760916/elizabeth-warren-anti-corruption-act-bill-lobbying-ban-president-trump

.@SenSanders, @RepRoKhanna & thousands of activists & workers pushed @Amazon to do the right thing – resulting in a huge win for workers. But the @FightFor15 doesn’t stop with Amazon. We’ll keep fighting to raise the federal minimum wage & ensure everyone makes a decent living. https://twitter.com/SenSanders/status/1047132430098927617 QT @SenSanders I want to congratulate Jeff Bezos for doing exactly the right thing by raising the minimum wage at Amazon and Whole Foods to $15 an hour.

Let me thank the hundreds of Amazon workers who contacted my office and the Fight for $15 movement, which has been leading this effort.

What happened at Amazon is a big step forward for workers across the nation. I want to thank the many hundreds of workers at Amazon fulfillment centers all across this country who contacted us and spoke up. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DohlBqqW4AAnce7.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1047196685410209794/vid/240x240/IPwEbUhe7nKs417o.mp4?tag=8

My opponent? Well, watch our newest TV ad... #TXSen

#RedTide has been documented for centuries. But the intensity & reach we have seen this year has no precedent. Yesterday it was confirmed off #PalmBeach in rare outbreak for #Florida east coast. The most urgent issue facing our state is water quality.

RT @RoKhanna .@BernieSanders & I introduced the Bezos Act a month ago asking billion dollar companies to pay for their employees’ public benefits. We urged Mr. Bezos to raise wages to $15. The beltway economists crucified us. But Mr. Bezos listened. Today thousands of workers are better off. https://twitter.com/davidsirota/status/1047114451034337281 QT @davidsirota .@BernieSanders & @RoKhanna were criticized for their legislation that was designed to shame Amazon and other low-wage employers. But here is the result of their pressure campaign👇🏻 https://twitter.com/ap/status/1047071590830280704

I want to congratulate Jeff Bezos for doing exactly the right thing by raising the minimum wage at Amazon and Whole Foods to $15 an hour.

Let me thank the hundreds of Amazon workers who contacted my office and the Fight for $15 movement, which has been leading this effort.

Enjoyed meeting with Texas constituents at our nation’s capital this morning at #Texas Tuesday Coffee! http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Dog1bfEXsAEBEQ3.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Dog1bfEW4AAAWM1.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Dog1bfFWkAE5zhw.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Dog1bfFWkAAX28T.jpg

Our government functions best when it is transparent & accountable to its citizens. I'm proud to join my fellow border-state Senators @SenatorTomUdall and @MartinHeinrich to introduce a bill to require DHS to establish pilot programs for body-worn cameras on ICE and CBP agents.
RT @Newsweek Houston pizza restaurant puts out a banner to encourage Ted Cruz as a customer https://trib.al/ebPTjHK http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DogRxV3XsAAPrvO.jpg

Children should not be taken to tent camps in the desert in the middle of the night. This is not border security. This is a human rights abuse. 
https://www.nytimes.com/2018/09/30/us/migrant-children-tent-city-texas.html

This is what happens when we stand up and fight for justice together. The time is now for Walmart, McDonald's and the fast food, airline, and the retail industry in general to start paying their workers a living wage — at least $15 per hour. https://jacobinmag.com/2018/10/jeff-bezos-amazon-wage-union-sanders

What Mr. Bezos has done today is not only enormously important for Amazon’s hundreds of thousands of employees, it could well be a shot heard around the world. I urge corporate leaders around the country to follow Mr. Bezos' lead. https://twitter.com/AP/status/1047071590830280704 QT @AP BREAKING: Amazon says it is increasing its minimum wage for all US workers to $15 per hour starting next month.

A lot is happening in the news right now and I wanted to make sure you saw this: hundreds of immigrant children were rounded up in the middle of the night and moved to a tent city. This is another stain on our nation’s history.
https://www.nytimes.com/2018/09/30/us/migrant-children-tent-city-texas.html
Dr. Ford is a profile in courage. She knew what she was up against when she came forward but spoke out because she felt it was her civic duty. She deserves better.

Proud of @JasonKander for his courage in sharing his struggle with PTSD. 

Jason, thank you for your contagious strength. I wish you well on your patriotic journey.

What else is he hiding that he doesn't want the people to know? 🤔 https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1047206293361123329 QT @nytimes President Trump has sold himself as a self-made billionaire but a Times investigation found that he received more than $400 million from his father’s empire, much of it through dubious tax schemes during the 1990s, including instances of outright fraud. https://trib.al/WUr9FN7

This Inspector General report is devastating. Even as DHS pursued its inhumane family separation policy, the agency was totally unprepared to identify, track, and reunify families. As I've said many times, Secretary Nielsen must resign. https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/trumps-family-separation-policy-was-flawed-from-the-start-watchdog-review-says/2018/10/01/c7134d86-c5ba-11e8-9b1c-a90f1daae309_story.html?utm_term=.0e16dc253590

Judge Kavanaugh repeatedly misled the Senate Judiciary Committee while under oath. This dishonest behavior is not befitting a Supreme Court justice, and disqualifies Kavanaugh from being confirmed to our country’s highest court. https://www.nytimes.com/2018/09/28/us/politics/brett-kavanaugh-fact-check.html

We need financial information from our elected officials in order to vet them properly. It’s a shield against future corruption – and that’s why I’ve introduced a bill to force candidates to disclose their tax returns and disclosed 10 years of my own returns.

Thurgood Marshall was sworn in to the Supreme Court on this day in 1967, becoming the first Black American to sit on the Court. He would go on to serve for 24 years, becoming a powerful voice for civil rights and social justice.

He dedicated his life to correcting wrongs. He fought back against hate.  He brought people together. May you rest on peace, Ray. 

https://www.azcentral.com/story/news/local/arizona/2018/10/01/lgbtq-caucus-democratic-party-passed-away/1494963002/
